meanings.definition: Excessive sensitivity of the skin or sense organs.
meanings.sent1: Her hyperaesthesia made her unable to tolerate even the gentlest touch.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed the patient with hyperaesthesia after noticing their extreme reaction to light touch.
meanings.sent3: The hyperaesthesia of the cat was evident when it jumped at the slightest sound, thinking it was a mouse.
meanings.sent4: His hyperaesthesia was like having a superpower, being able to feel things others couldn't even sense.
meanings.sent5: The hyperaesthesia of the detective allowed him to notice the smallest details at the crime scene.

meanings.definition: Abnormal acuteness of sensitivity to stimuli.
meanings.sent1: The hyperaesthesia caused him to feel pain from sounds that others couldn't even hear.
meanings.sent2: The hyperaesthesia in her fingertips made her an excellent pianist, able to feel every note deeply.
meanings.sent3: His hyperaesthesia was so extreme that he could feel the vibrations of a butterfly's wings from far away.
meanings.sent4: The hyperaesthesia of the artist allowed him to capture the emotions of his subjects with incredible detail.
meanings.sent5: The hyperaesthesia of the flower made it bloom earlier than the others, reacting to the slightest change in temperature.
